ok.. how about linux/linux setup? i can adapt for windows as it has a good gui unlike linux
there is quicksynergy a gui for synergy in the repos if you need a gui. put that on the server. run synergyc HOST on the client.
so after i have the server setup, i just run synergyc (client side) and voila?

in the quicksynergy - if you are using the gui - put the client name in the appropriate location. If you don't use the gui, you need to edit the config files yourself. They are pretty straight forward. then yes, it's just a voila. keyboard/mouse/clipboard will be "shared"
also, how do i get it to start automatically from adding synergy as a session? synergyc right?
sure, just launch the appropriate commands at startup. "synergyc HOST" will be from the client.
